function.name: label
function.comment: Declares a label for 'goto' command.

function.name: skipNext
function.param: Number of commands to skip. Default 1.
function.comment: Skip one or several next commands, as given in parameter amount.

function.name: goto
function.param: Name of a label to go to
function.comment: Go to the position at the given label.

function.name: gotoIf
function.param: Condition expression. If it evaluates to true (compared non-strictly), then the control goes to a statement at the given label.
Name of a label to go to
function.comment: Go to the position at the given label, if condExpr evaluates to true (compared non-strictly).

function.name: if
function.param: Condition expression. It determines whether to run the positive branch or negative branch (if present).
function.comment: Conditional statement and a start of its positive branch. It evaluates given condExpr. If it evaluates to true (compared non-strictly), then the control flow continues until the matching endIf or matching else (if present). Otherwise, if there is a matching else statement, then the control continues from there (the negative branch). Otherwise it continues from the matching endIf.

function.name: else
function.comment:
Negative branch of a matching if statement; optional. If the matching if evaluated its condition as false (compared non-strictly), then it passes the control here.
If the condition evaluated as true (compared non-strictly), then the positive branch was processed (i.e. any statements between the matching if and this else). On reaching this else, the control skips this negative branch and continues from the matching endIf.

function.name: endIf
function.comment: End of conditional statement. After evaluating the condition of the matching if and after running its positive (if) branch or its negative branch (else, if present), the control switches here. endIf ends the whole if (and optional else) structure. It ends the negative branch (else, if present), otherwise it ends the positive branch (if).

function.name: while
function.comment: Conditional loop statement. As far as it evaluates to true (compared non-strictly), it keeps running all statements up to the matching endWhile.

function.name: endWhile
function.comment: End of the matching while.

function.name: for
function.param: Composite defining loop bounds and repetition condition, C/C++/Java/Javascript/PHP-like, in 3 parts separated by semicolons: initiation; condition; iteration. For example: i=0; i <= 100; i++
List of variable(s) used in either initiation, condition or iteration parts of parameter forSpec.
function.comment: Loop with initiation, condition for repetition and iteration. First, it evaluates the initiation part of parameter forSpec. Then it evaluates the condition part of forSpec. If true (compared non-strictly), it runs any statement(s) between this for and its matching endFor. On reaching the matching endFor, it evaluates iteration part of forSpec. Then it evaluates the condition part again and if true, it repeats the statements again... When the condition part evaluates to false (compared non-strictly), it passes the control to the matching endFor statement.

function.name: endFor
function.comment: End of for loop.

function.name: foreach
function.param: Variable name, that will be assigned values from valueExpr.
Comma-separated values or expressions, that will be iterated through. Can be empty.
function.comment: It iterates through given list of values/expressions, assigning each to a stored variable with name varName. For each value, it then runs statement(s) up to the matching endForeach.

function.name: endForeach
function.comment: End of the matching foreach.

function.name: loadVars
function.param: File path or a URI to an xml file to load. Value sets is loaded from <vars> element(s).
Boolean condition to select a set of values from the XML. Optional; if not present, then the XML must have exactly one set of variables - one element <vars>.
function.comment: Load a set of variable(s) from an XML. If condition is present, then loadVars keeps reading sets of values from XML, until the condition evaluates to true (compared non-strictly). If it reaches the end of XML and the condition is still false, loadVars fails. Each set of variable(s) is within its <vars> element. See original reference at http://refactoror.wikia.com/wiki/Selblocks_Reference for more.

function.name: forXml
function.param: File path or a URI to an xml file.
function.comment: An XML-based loop. (I think that) on each iteration, it loads a set of variables from the XML (one set of variables per one element <vars>). Then it runs any statement(s) up to the matching endForXml.

function.name: endForXml
function.comment: End of the matching forXml.

function.name: continue
function.comment: Jump back to top of the current (innermost active) loop for next iteration, if any.

function.name: breakLoop
function.comment: Jump back to the bottom of the current (innermost active) loop and exit it.

function.name: call
function.param: Name of the script to call.
Argument(s) passed to the called script, optional. Comma-separated assignments in form variableName=expression. You can use $storedVariableName to access stored variables in expression.
function.comment:
Call a script with the given name. Just like calling a function/method in common programming languages. It
saves any stored variables, and it removes them from the current scope
puts all given arguments to the current scope of stored variables
passes control to the called script
The called script may be in a different test case, as far as it's a part of the same test suite (this is how SelBlocks Global differs from Sel Blocks). If the called script finishes correctly - either at its endScript or return (if present) - then
the control is passed back to the caller
any stored variables from the called script are lost
the original stored variables are loaded to the scope
any returned result from the called script is avaliable in stored variable _result

function.name: function
function.comment: Start of a script, which is a callable block, like a function/method in common programming languages. It gets invoked via call statement. It can (optionally) receive parameter(s) and it can (optionally) return a value via return. It has a separate scope of stored variables. It contains statement(s) up to the nearest endScript. It can call other scripts via call, but it cannot contain other scripts within itself. It can call itself recursively, either directly or indirectly.

function.name: return
function.comment: It ends the currently executed script, returning the flow control to the caller and passing given value as stored variable _result.

function.name: endFunction
function.comment: It ends the currently executed script, returning the flow control to the caller, without setting stored variable _result.

function.param:
What to index by. Either
string - name of the column to index by
object { indexBy string, name of the field to index by; required. Values of this field must be unique within the source, unless you also use subIndexBy.
subIndexBy string, name of the field to sub-index by; optional. Used to index within groups or objects that have same indexBy value. Values of this field must be unique within each group.
target string, name of the result stored variable; optional
}
